Reviews.Title: “Perfect hostal and location for a citytrip”
Reviews.Author: BrigenEd
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. Nice hostal nearby Gran Villa and Chueca. Clean small room with a spanish bed and bath.Friendly staff. Free wifi.You get what your money is worth. would stay there again when we come to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “we'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: fantastic location, easy for our early morning trek to the airport bus. air conditioning and friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need!”
Reviews.Author: Tina W
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in the cosy Chueca quartier in the middle of Madrid, within walking distance from most museums, metro stations, buses etc. Arriving at one in the morning was not a problem as there is someone at the reception desk 24/7. Loved the little terrasse at the reception with a view over Madrids rooftops. Very friendly and helpful staff, the rooms small and simple but clean and clean towels every day. A calm street ,just off the busy Gran via, where you instantly feel you're in a village. Paralell to a small pedestian shopping street, lots of shops, cafés and restaurants. If you're not looking for luxury but simple easy and friendly, this is a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal location that is very close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: ass0uma
Reviews.Content: This hostal is in an old European building that has an elevator. We stayed there for 3 nights in 2 triple rooms. The rooms are clean with private bathroom, T.V. and A/ C but there is no minibar or any kitchen facility. It has a very big advantage which is its very central location! It is few steps from Gran Via and Puerto del Sol. There are wonderful shops near by, of different types, as souvenir shops, leather shops and various restaurants! Again I assure you that the best thing about this hotel is its great location and its reasonable price. You can spend nice time till late at night in the area around without worrying about the late transport. The hotel can be reached easily by metro as it is about 2 minutes walk from Gran Via metro station. Its proximity to the metro station facilitates transport to farther visiting touristic places. You can also ride the tour bus from the near Gran Via street and enjoy the tour. I' ll sure stay in it again if I visit Spain again one day!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean, Small”
Reviews.Author: Reisevenn75
Reviews.Content: Like some other hotels in Chueca, the rooms in this hotel are also on the small side although I have stayed here before, in a different room, which was much bigger. The room this time, was located on the 5th floor, (1 floor below reception). and was about 9 square meters (this is an estimate). However, the bathroom was big enough where you could at least turn around in the shower. Beds (linen and covers) felt old and I felt like it could have been renewed. Again I can not remember that the other room we had 2 years ago gave me that feeling. The service was ok, but we didn´t really have to interact much with the personnel as we only stayed one evening. The location was good and very central.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelgal_5219
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of an Intrepid tour so not sure about the cost. The hostal is in a great area, just on the border of the gay district, very close to Gran Via, Puerto de Sol (metro station), lots of shopping and restaurants galore (to meet every budget). The hostal is located on the the 5th floor of the building and has a great patio which is nice if you pick up food to go and don't want to sit in your room. The staff is very helpful and I really liked the system they have of requesting that you leave your key behind when you go out - good to keep track (esp in the evenings) of who is yet to come back. When you pickup your key and head to where the rooms are located - there is a door which the front desk will buzz you through - makes a solo female traveller feel at ease. The room itself was spacious (at least for myself as one person) and came with clean towels, a luggage rack, a safe, a desk (nice addition) and was comfortable but don't expect luxury. Also for both of the nights that we stayed I noticed there was a lot of noise from outside at night which without earplugs would have made it impossible to sleep - so make sure you bring some if staying here. I would stay here again in order to explore Madrid further - why spend your euros on luxurious accomodation and segregate yourself from the Spanish experience - spend on the food instead!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Simple”
Reviews.Author: JEricksom
Reviews.Content: The hostel is located on the 5th floor of a building, just off the Gran Via. It was very central to everything. It is a bare bones place and noise carrys very well. However the noise does stop at 11 and doesn't start again until around 7. It was clean and simple. If you are a light sleeper this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: sally_forth15
Reviews.Content: This place is simply delightful and cosy, being on the fifth floor of a building on a busy street in central Madrid where you can walk to practically anywhere and it's near the shopping district! We got ourselves a quad room, which was located at the end of of the corridor (perfectly out of the way). I really like the room because it feels as if the person who designed and set it up really put in lots of effort and thoughts to make the room sweet and welcoming. There are a window, side tables, mirror, wardrobe, chairs, luggage rack, a safe, 2 plug points, a small tv, a 1-horse power air-cond and free wifi (get password from reception). The attached bathroom is superb- again, kudos to the designer. Packets of shampoo, soap bars, towels and toilet paper are provided. There is also a toilet just outside the room, so it can be used during emergency when the attached bathroom is occupied. Being on the fifth floor means you need to take the lift up and it can only accommodate 3 people at a time. There is a small but nice reception and the guy who welcomed us was very friendly. He explained the security features: a locked door before the corridor towards the rooms (reception will open it for you). Walking along the corridor from the reception to the room leaves you with a sense of being at home because it's very thoughtfully decorated and nicely laid out with flowers, paintings and chairs. After being out the whole day, it's great to have such a homey place to come back to. Well done to the people at Hostal America! :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Choice in Bustling Chueca”
Reviews.Author: Curious2011
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Madrid where I stayed in the Hostal America while attending language school at InHispania (a word of caution here - this is not a language school I would recommend for anyone over the age of 35). The room was small, very clean, with A/C, private bath, maid service, clean towels every day, soap and shampoo, hair dryer and TV. The lobby and balcony had good full strength wi-fi, less so in the rooms. I had a room overlooking the airwell, so had no noise at night. The front desk was extremely helpful and solicitous. As a female traveling alone, I felt extremely safe and well-looked after here. The balcony was a fabulous place to do homework and watch the lovely Madrid sunsets. The location was superb as I could walk anywhere in downtown Madrid. For a budget hotel in a choice location, I don't think you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: sunlover831
Reviews.Content: For location you can't get much better, and for such a decent price! It is just off Gran Via, and walking distance to everything you'd want to see or do. The staff were really helpful, especially the guy on the first day shift who gave us lots of help, from finding internet cafes, laundry and good resturants, to explaining the Menu del dia system that they have in Spain. The room was on the small side, but this is no problem, and the bathroom is a good size. The only negative thing we had was that people are able to smoke in their rooms, so when other guests are smoking it drifted down the hall and came into our room, which was yuck, but everyone seems to smoke everywhere in Spain - just goes with the territory. Walls also a bit thin, but nothing ear plugs can't deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option”
Reviews.Author: AEF_9
Reviews.Content: If you're expecting luxury, don't stay here. If you want a clean, cheap, friendly hostel in the middle of everything, this is a good option.I stayed for 6 nights while going to language school, and it's basic, but it has everything you need, is clean and friendly and also free wi-fi. The location is great -on the edge of Chueca, 30 seconds from Gran Via, 5 mins walk from Puerta de Sol, another 5 or so to Plaza Major. Not much traffic noise from the street (I was in a room at the front). Noise from fellow guests coming home in the wee hours (the norm in Madrid), could be a problem, but, hey, this is Madrid, and you're on holidays, so get over it. :)

Reviews.Title: “The room was very noisy, smelled of smoke, shower flowed in intermittent flow.”
Reviews.Author: bajalin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was unable to change our room location, as they were fully booked. Someone else on our tour had been offered our room prior to my arrival and she also declined the room. The hotel staff found an air conditioning remote controller to enable us to use the air conditioning in an unsuccessful attempt to drown out the street noise and attempt to mitigate the strong smell of smoke. There was noise until 5 am on the street. There was no space to sit comfortably on the toilet. Definitely not spaced to any code standard. Our room was changed on the second night and this room was slightly better. On the positive side: no bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, convenient location, reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Adele B
Reviews.Content: Hostal America isn't for everyone - but it is for people who travel on a budget and yet expect cleanliness, security, convenience, and a good night's sleep. It even has a terrace to look over Madrid's rooftops! It's on the top the 4th and 5th floors but has elevator as well. I spent two different nights in two different rooms and both times was more than satisfied. Both rooms also had a coin security-box (although the second room's box wasn't working!!!) which is always a great way for peace of mind. The all-day presence in the hostel lobby is staffed by easy-going, efficient people who graciously speak English. They helped with some very useful walking/metro advice. The night guy didn't speak much English though. I love the street that it's on - funky, utilitarian, great cafe across the street, and so convenient to Gran Via (cenral metro stop too!), Puerta del Sol as well as accessing Malasena and Chueca areas. I'd definately stay at Hostel America again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in the Heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: spartan95
Reviews.Content: I visited Madrid for three nights while on a two week European tour and stayed at the Hostal America. I arrived in Madrid several hours later than planned and a representative from the airport called verified my reservation would be honored. It was after midnight when I arrived and I was welcomed in and escorted to my room promptly liked an old family friend. The host had clearly waited up for me after the call from the airport. I felt like a welcomed guest and even though my Spanish is limited I was able to communicate with the family that runs the hostal enough to feel comfortable and well cared for. When I exited the subway at midnight the first night on the Grand Via there were several policemen who were in the area which made me question my choice but come the next morning when I walked out into the street I realized the neighborhood was safe. The hotel is on the border of a gay friendly neighborhood and one with many trendy shops and Western hotels. There are several hostals in this building. There are several internet cafes and ATM's close by. I had drinks two nights at the Stop Bar down the street and got to practice my Spanish with a visiting businessman who was astonished that a single American girl could stumble upon his favorite watering hole. There are plenty of great inexpensive restaurants and bars within a few blocks. For the price this is a wonderful, clean, safe place to stay just 2 blocks from the subway. The room I stayed in is tiny but has a nice small bathroom and large window and was plenty of space for me to sleep. At first I was concerned that the hosts didn't want me to take the room key with me but on the first night I was there I realized that it was so they would know when all of their guests were in for the night and they could lock the door. Since I was alone and halfway around the world from home it was comforting to know that someone was waiting up for me to turn in.

Reviews.Title: “So So.....”
Reviews.Author: ClareandMichaelPerth
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hostal America for 3 nights in July 2008. We paid $89AUD per night for a Private Double Room. The hostel is in a good location, very central, however if you aren't opened minded about homosexuals you may not enjoy the location. Our room consisted of 2 single beds (which we pushed together), a desk, wardrobe, small TV, Aircon & Private Bathroom. The room was clean. The hostel is very old fashioned. There is no breakfast, no Internet and the owners speak very little English. It is also very dimly lit. Most hostels also provide you with some information of the area and a map. We didn't receive any of this. The hostel is quiet, however the people staying in the next room were not. They let their kids rollerblade up and down the hallway. The location is good but there is not a lot to do in Madrid so it didn't really have much effect. We originally booked 4 nights but once we arrived, we decided to cancel the 4th night. We cancelled the 4th night more than 48 hours in advance (48 hours is standard cancellation policy for all hostels) but the owners told us we could not & we would have to pay for the room. We didn't end up paying thanks to our persistance but it was a hassle trying to arrange anything with the staff or owners.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed twice, first room was better...”
Reviews.Author: grantosphotos
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 3 nights here and really loved it - the room was simple but good value, clean and comfortable, with efficient air conditioning. We then spent another night here a week later with our parents taking another 2 rooms - this time whilst our room was again clean and comfortable, it was also noisy due to the lift and smelt of cigarette smoke. Overall I'd suggest staying here as it's great value and the Chueca area is fun, but try to get a back room and on the 5th floor - it seemed better than the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Simple & Clean Hostal -- Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: purplevida7
Reviews.Content: This hostal was in a great location! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Ask for a room in the interior courtyard...it's much quieter. It was a very simple room, but it was clean. Clean towels and linens & TV. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hostal”
Reviews.Author: gvlaker
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to add to other recent reviews. This was a great place to stay in Madrid: The location and price were excellent; the staff was very friendly; and the rooms were clean and comfortable. I enjoyed spending time on the terrace. Yes, the room was small; but, it was big enough to sleep and shower in. There wasn't any noise from the streets; but noise did carry from room to room. I can find only two things to criticize: (1) The hot water was a little flaky, and (2) the bed could have been more comfortable. Overall, it was an excellent value, and I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, simple but clean room”
Reviews.Author: traveling_geek_14
Reviews.Content: This hostal (cheap hotel) has a great location - on Hortaleza Street very near the Gran Via metro station and in the middle of Chueca, a fantastic gay friendly neighborhood with shops, cafes, restaurants and clubs. The room was fairly basic (ceramic tile floor, simple furniture that has seen better days, the bathroom not recently remodeled), but clean and with all the amenities you'd expect for the price (towels, soap, TV). The busy street can be a bit noisy on weekend nights but this is offset with the rooms located on 4th and 5th floors and fitted with new aluminum frame windows with blinds. There is air-conditioning, free WI-FI and an elevator. As there is no breakfast, I recommend cafes and other business just down the street (a fantastic bakery, a falafel place). An ATM is also located just a few doors down the street. The day staff speak English, but the night watchmen does not. Still, no problems as he understood our attempts at Spanish and pointing to objects.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great little Gem in the Heart of Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: CentaurTheFirst
Reviews.Content: Situated just off Gran Via (very busy) and Chueca (very happening!) this little gem of a hostal served all our needs from comfortable beds to hot showers in a twin room (best to ask for this size as I believe that the double rooms were on the small size) and our room faced the inner courtyard on the 4th floor which meant that some of the noise was kept to a minimum. (ask for quiet room)The hostal had a lift and a roof terrace with views of the city which was a pleasant surprise and lovely to sit out at any time of the day. The rooms were cleaned everyday, decor was dated with dark furniture but if you can surpass this and think that its only a place to sleep then everything is on your doorstep - from walking to the Prado (make sure you look for the right entrance if your going to visit the Goya exhibitions, otherwise if you have no ticket they will not make an exception and you will have to que again outside to get back in - the Prado receives no votes from me for its appalling lack of communication where many people filled in a complaint forms but nothing was done) to eating a menu del dia for euros8.50 with a bottle of wine in the same street (turn left outside the hostal door and its a mere 3mins walk either for the New Travares or the Old Tavares restaurant serving decent sized meals. The street was very busy and you can get everything that you need and so many places to eat (arm yourself with say the Rough Guide to Madrid which was a real help for me). Our receptionist Carlos was a great help in locating Flamenco shows (great!) etc and nothing was too much trouble for him. Also visit the Tourist Board as soon as you arrive at the Airport which will give you a guide to 'whats happening' the week that you are visiting or log onto their website. The costs of our room was euros 55 per night for 2. I would definately go back to Hostal America as it was in the heart of Madrid and we did not need to buy any travel tickets as all the attractions was close to hand, so go on and enjoy Madrid, just make sure you take sensible walking shoes!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cumm00032
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room at the Hostal America for 3 nights. The hotel is in a great location and easy to get to from the metro. There are many great cafes and bars within walking distant of the hotel. I bought a 3 day metro pass whilst in Madrid but ended up walking everywhere. The Prado is about a 30 minute walk. The best thing about the Hostal America is that is very clean, and the rooms get serviced every day. This isn't by any means a luxury hotel (the single rooms are quite small) but if you want a cheap hotel in a central location then I wouldn't look past the Hostal America.
